title: New: Halls – Roses For The Dead
content:
I’m almost ashamed that this is the first time South London dark-pop artist Halls has appeared on Crack in the Road, given his consistently high quality output.

With his debut LP Ark out 15 October on No Pain In Pop, the genius behind Halls aka Sam Howard has given the premiere of new track Roses For The Dead to Pitchfork (as you do). Wonderfully gloomy and startlingly intoxicating, it’s a sonic assault, recalling the downtrodden mist that hovered over the UK in the late 70s / early 80s. These are tense times, and Halls knows that all too well. Check out Roses For The Dead below (stream via The405)
